newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates see-saw to end up.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates see-saw to end up.

text.p: Pakistan's overnight money rates swung before ending up on Tuesday amid uncertainty about liquidity, and were seen high on Wednesday, dealers said.

Early offers were at 15 to 16 percent but plummeted to six percent, a dealer at Standard Chartered Bank said. Within half an hour the market surged to 17 percent and at the end of the day small trades took place at 18 percent.

A dealer at KASB & Co said rates were likely to stay firm on Wednesday amid tight liquidity due to an open market operation. The central bank was likely to pick up at least two billion rupees in the operation against an inflow of 1.3 billion rupees.
